Name: 125 Chubb Ave.
Extended Description:
Client: RXR Realty

Project Type: Base Building Renovations

Project Size: 265,000 SF

Architect: Perkins Eastman Architects, PC

The Walsh Company provided construction management services on the renovation of this 265,000 SF building located in Lyndhurst, New Jersey. The renovation consisted of upgrades to the 5 story lobby, common corridors, bathrooms, kitchen and seating area as well as the build out of a new fitness center equipped with locker rooms, bathrooms and showers. New HVAC and building management systems were also installed. The building’s façade was upgraded along with the landscaping, parking lot and site lighting.

Name: 15 Mercedes Drive
Extended Description:
Project Type: Base Building Renovations

Project Size: 60,000 SF

Architect: SNS Architects

The Walsh Company provided construction management services for Hampshire Real Estate Companies for the complete renovation of an existing 60,000 SF single story office building located in Montvale, New Jersey.  

The scope of work included stripping the exterior down to the structural steel and installing a new glass and stone façade as well as a new combination roof consisting of rubber and standing seam metal.  New package HVAC roof top units were also installed and the parking lot and landscaping were upgraded to Class A office standards. The Walsh Company also obtained all of the approvals for construction and leased the building to Coining, Inc., the largest manufacturer of gold tin and other solder and brazing preforms worldwide.

Name: Adams Respiratory Therapeutics
Extended Description:
Project Type: Development

Project Size: 32,000 SF

Architect: The Kimmerle Group

The Walsh Company was responsible for the completion of the 32,000 SF shell building as well as the design, construction, furniture procurement and move management for Adams RespiratoryTherapeutics located in the exclusive enclave of Chester Borough.  Mill Ridge Office Center was owned by a partnership of executives from Avison Young.

Name: Ames Hotel
Extended Description:
Project Type: Hospitality

Project Size: 120,000 SF/ 114 Rooms

Architect: Cambridge 7, ADD Inc., Rockwell Group - Interior Designer

Walsh Company provided project management services for the Ames Hotel project for Normandy Real Estate Partners, managing all aspects of the project development including permitting and approvals, the architect, consultants, and the construction manager.  The firm also was responsible for the coordination of the FF&E installation for the project.  The historic Ames Hotel is located in the financial district of Boston.  The $50 million dollar project is a renovation of one of Boston’s first skyscrapers towering 14 stories high. The interior of this boutique style hotel features 114 luxury rooms, private dining, an upscale full service restaurant and bar, and fitness center.

Name: BASF
Extended Description:
Project Type: New Building

Project Size: 325,000 SF

Architect: KPF & Gensler

The Walsh Company provided tenant representation services for BASF’s new 325,000 SF North American headquarters facility. BASF achieved LEED Double Platinum Certification on both the core and shell and interiors. In addition to a new environment for the organization, the intent was to include the use of as many products containing BASF components in all of the construction and FF&E materials. The Walsh Company managed the coordination between base building and tenant work, all the consultants, BASF’s vendors for IT, audio visual, security and furniture, and the contractor.

Name: Beumer Corporation
Extended Description:
Project Type: Industrial

Project Size: 162,000 SF

Architect: Ben Hornton

Name: Cheder
Extended Description:
CURRENT PROJECT

Project Type: Education

Project Size: 25,000 SF

Architect: Ben Horton

The Walsh Company was awarded the Cheder School project on Broad Street in Clifton, NJ. We are working with the school as their General Contractor/Construction Manager. The two story building is being converted from office to a private educational school, with site improvements.

Name: Citadines Hotel
Extended Description:
Project Type: Hospitality

Project Size: 46,000 sq ft/ 125 Rooms

Architect: TPG

Located on the corner of 45th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues, Citadines Connect Fifth Avenue Hotel New York is your doorway to all of New York City. As a guest, you are footsteps from Times Square, Fifth Avenue Shopping, Theatre District, and Rockefeller Center. If you are visiting for business and need to venture out of Midtown into the Financial District, Chelsea, SoHo, or even New Jersey, you are minutes from all of New York’s major transportation Hubs – Grand Central, Subway lines, and Port Authority. Hotel features 125 modern guest rooms equipped with USB wall outlets and wireless internet access. A complimentary grab-and-go breakfast ensures that you are fully energized.

Name: Claremont Corporate Center
Extended Description:
Project Type: Development

Project Size: 42,000 SF

Architect: WESKetch Architecture

The Walsh Company worked with Claremont Corporate Center, LLC as the owner’s representative on the design and construction of a new 42,000 sf building and a two story 40,000 sf subgrade parking garage. The project, located in Summit, New Jersey, included the redevelopment of a historic mansion built at the turn of the century. The firm managed all the consultants and the contractor for the core and shell construction.

Name: Clyde & Co.
Extended Description:
Project Type: Law Office

Project Size: 22,000 SF

Architect: The Kimmerle Group

The Walsh Company provided tenant representation and construction management services for Clyde & Co.’s New Jersey location. Walsh was responsible for the oversight of the design, construction and office relocation. Services included the development of project budget and schedule, furniture procurement and contracting the qualified consultants.
‍

The renovation consisted of approximately 22,000 SF of existing office space including conferencing, breakout area, lounge and an executive pantry. New characteristics include a full height curved glass wall that divides the reception and waiting areas from the centralized conferencing zones. The office now features a classic modern design which can be seen throughout the space.

Name: Covanta Energy
Extended Description:
Project Type: Corporate Interiors

Project Size: 108,000 SF

Architect: Gensler

The Walsh Company provided Tenant Representation Services on the relocation and interior renovation of Covanta’s corporate headquarters from Fairfield, New Jersey to Morristown, New Jersey. The total size of the project was approximately 108,000 SF and included a 5,000 SF Tier 2 global data center, training facility, board room and executive offices. The interior space was designed by Gensler and featured both interior & exterior offices, as well as low-height workstations throughout the three “wings” of the large floor plate.  A regulation-sized basketball court was also constructed in the parking lot of the building for the executives and employees to enjoy. Through thoughtful design and careful coordination, the project was able to achieve LEED Gold Certification for Commercial Interiors.

Name: Day Pitney, LLC
Extended Description:
Project Type: Law Office

Project Size: 100,000 SF

Architect: Gensler

Day Pitney relocated their firm from a multi-tenant building in Florham Park, New Jersey to a 100,000 SF single tenant building in Parsippany. The newly constructed building had been vacant for 3 years with only the lobby and restrooms completed. As the project manager, The Walsh Company managed all the consultants, owner’s vendors and the contractor. The existing partner furniture was incorporated into the new design and new secretarial workstations were installed on all 3 floors. Building features include a conference center, café, patio for outdoor dining and a mail/copy center.

Name: Family Service of Morristown
Extended Description:
Project Type: Development

Project Size: 18,000 SF

Architect: Kapuscinski Luongo Architects

The Walsh Company worked with FSMC to identify an appropriate method in which to accomplish their project goals. After an extensive evaluation, it was determined that the needs of this long standing, non-profit organization would best be served by constructing a new 18,500 SF combination office/counseling center on a building lot adjoining their existing site. The Walsh Company aided in obtaining all approvals and oversaw all design and construction of the building's core and shell. Subsequently, due to budget requirements, The Walsh Company assumed responsibility for the design and build out of the tenant interiors. Our extensive industry contacts enabled us to control project costs through vendor donations and assistance.

Name: Gussco Manufacturing Inc.
Extended Description:
Project Type: Industrial

Project Size: 150,000 SF

Architect: Jarmel Kizel

The Walsh Company was contracted by Gussco Manufacturing Inc. to oversee the relocation of their entire 120,000 sf manufacturing facility from Brooklyn, New York to Cedar Grove, New Jersey. The relocation process included the purchase of a new building, design and construction of a 100,000 sf manufacturing/office facility and the design, site approval and construction of a new 20,000 SF warehouse. Gussco occupied their new facility at the end of 2006 after construction was completed. The Walsh Company then worked with Riverdrive Construction on building a new 20,000 sf warehouse addition.

Name: Interfaith Food Pantry
Extended Description:
Project Type: Development

Project Size: 13,502 SF

Architect: GSM Architects

As the owner’s representative for the Interfaith Food Pantry, The Walsh Company provided entitlement and construction management services for the construction of a new 13,502 SF building located within the Morris County Greystone Park Complex. The relocation and construction of this new facility is vital in assisting Morris County residents in need of supplemental and/or emergency non-perishable food. The facility includes a warehouse area that accommodates pallet racking and handling equipment to store and distribute approximately +/- 13,000 pounds of food per week. A client waiting area and a small working kitchen with an attached classroom will enable IFP to expand their nutritional, educational and outreach programs.

Name: Jet.com
Extended Description:
Project Type: Corporate Interiors

Project Size: 40,000 SF

Architect: IA Architects

The Walsh Company was retained as the Project Manager for Jet.com’s 40,000 SF new headquarters in Hoboken, NJ. Our services included managing consultants/contractors, budget & schedule management, furniture & construction oversight. After a successful completion, we were awarded Jet.com’s new call center in Salt Lake City.

Name: Langan Engineering
Extended Description:
Project Type: Corporate Interiors

Project Size: 76,866 SF

Architect: Gensler

Langan retained The Walsh Company as the Project Manager for their 76,866 SF new headquarters in Parsippany, NJ. Walsh's services included hiring and oversight of the General Contractor, management of the Architect and MEP Engineer, coordination and hiring of all vendors, along with the preparation & management of the overall budget/schedule.

After a successful completion of thisproject, The Walsh Company was awarded five new projects for Langan’s satelliteoffices located in Houston, Philadelphia, Bethlehem, Arlington & New Haven.

Name: Mount Pleasant Medical
Extended Description:
Project Type: Base Building Renovations

Project Size: 100,000 SF

Architect: Rotwein & Blake

As the owner’s representative for 375 Mount Pleasant Avenue, LLC and Hampshire Real Estate Companies, The Walsh Company provided project and construction management services for the redevelopment of Mount Pleasant Medical, a 100,000 sf facility located in West Orange, New Jersey.

Name: Newmark Education
Extended Description:
Project Type: Education

Project Size: 60,000 SF

Architect: Perkins Eastman

Newmark Education, a school for children with learning disabilities and behavioral disorders, engaged The Walsh Company to provide project management services on the consolidation of their existing grammar and high schools, located in Plainfield, New Jersey and Carteret, New Jersey. The new state of the art facility is located in Scotch Plains, New Jersey and accommodates grades K-12 along with the administrative staff.

The project consisted of the renovation of an existing office building and the construction of 2 new building. The school is equipped with a cafeteria, gym, learning commons and teacher training area, designated for educating and training teachers from around the country.

The new school features an exterior brick façade with large windows and a grand two story atrium lobby. The interior was specifically designed with wide corridors and plenty of skylights allowing the natural light to filter in. Daylight controls were also installed to conserve energy. Newmark Education creates an intimate, family-like environment where their students’ individual needs are met.

Name: Newmark Knight Frank
Extended Description:
Project Type: Corporate Interiors

Project Size: 10,000 SF

Architect: AXIS

Newmark Knight Frank relocated their office to a new 10,000 sf office space located at 301 Route 17 North, tenth floor in Rutherford, New Jersey. The Walsh Company was contracted as a General Contractor responsible for obtaining all permits and inspections, hiring and overseeing of all applicable trade contractors, coordination of all furniture deliveries and installation and coordination of client-hired contractors. The Walsh Company maintained the same responsibilities when Newmark Knight Frank acquired 2,000 sf of expansion space.

Name: NJ Sharing Network
Extended Description:
Project Type: Corporate Interiors

Project Size: 48,000 SF

Architect: Posen Architects

The Walsh Company served as the tenant representative and construction manager for NJ Sharing on the relocation of their headquarters facility to New Providence, NJ. The 48,000 SF office space, including 47,000 SF of lab, owned by The Hampshire Companies was chosen by NJ Sharing and Posen Architects. Walsh worked with the client to coordinate the design of the space and hired the necessary consultants for IT, AV and Security. Walsh oversaw the construction and coordination with the direct hire of subcontractors. The project required phased relocation of specialty equipment and refrigerated specimens as part of the process.

Name: Panasonic
Extended Description:
Project Type: New Building

Project Size: 250,000 SF

Architect: HLW

Panasonic’s built-to-suit headquarters is located at 2 Riverfront Plaza in Newark, NJ. The LEED Gold building consists of 12 floors totaling over 340,000 sf. Panasonic will occupy 10 floors totaling 280,000 SF. The space includes a state-of-the-art Idea Center, that will be visible from the outside and from the street. The Idea Center highlights Panasonic’s products and commitment to the environment through their solar and energy-efficient products. The build out also includes an employee cafeteria and rec room, complete with pool and shuffleboard tables. The second floor is a 28,000 sf conference center with rooms sized for 2 to 150 people. The eight work floors consists of open, collaborative work stations, with direct views to the outdoors from every employee’s seat.

Name: Quest Diagnostics
Extended Description:
Project Type: Corporate Interiors

Project Size: 141,000 SF

Architect: Hillier Architects

The Walsh Company provided tenant representation services for Quest Diagnostics on their office relocation from Lyndhurst, New Jersey to Giralda Farms, Madison, New Jersey. Additionally, Walsh worked with RexCorp, who acted as the construction manager on the partial renovation of Quest’s new 141,000 sf office space. This project consisted of upgrades to the existing lobby, café, conference, training and dining areas, as well as a complete renovation of the fourth floor executive level.

Name: Reckitt Benckiser
Extended Description:
Project Type: Corporate Interiors

Project Size: 120,000 SF

Architect: IA, Interior Architects

As the Tenant Representative for Reckitt Benckiser, The Walsh Company managed the renovation and re-stack of Reckitt’s North America headquarters facility located in Parsippany, New Jersey.  

The renovation consisted of three, 40,000 SF floors accommodating an open floor plan with only nine offices. Intermittent collaborative teaming areas, small huddle and bubble rooms allow the staff to meet in the open plan and also hold private meetings, when necessary. New pantries equipped with espresso machines, coffee makers and a tea kettle are featured on each floor, as well as larger conference spaces. The 20,000 SF space on the 2nd floor was transformed into a conference center. Improvements included, new carpeting and ceiling throughout, repainting of existing conference and storage rooms and major renovations to the existing restrooms. The space also features a new reception area, coffee bar cafe, and a 900 SF grocery store simulation.

Name: REED Academy
Extended Description:
Project Type: Education

Project Size: 25,000 SF

Architect: WXY Architecture & Urban Design

The Walsh Company worked with the Reed Academy as the owner’s representative on the construction of a new 25,000 SF school located in Oakland New Jersey. Walsh managed the overall process including: project planning, budgeting construction management and value engineering. The single story building is equipped with state of the art educational technology as well as a child friendly environment conducive for learning. The design also includes a landscaped campus intended for student outdoor activities.

Name: Samsung
Extended Description:
Project Type:

Project Size: 40,000 SF

Architect: Gensler

Name: Schenck, Price, Smith & King
Extended Description:
Project Type: Law Office

Project Size: 40,000 SF

Architect: Chapin Architectural Services

Operating in Morristown, New Jersey for 100 years, Schenck, Price, Smith & King consolidated their legal departments and relocated the firm to Florham Park, New Jersey. As the construction manager, The Walsh Company renovated the existing 30,000 SF office space, built an additional 10,000 SF of new space and managed the entire relocation. It was very important for SPS&K to conserve the character and culture of the firm and to have it "visually" conveyed in their new home. This was achieved by focusing mainly on the new 10,000 SF office space which includes a high-end reception area with marble floors and cherry wall paneling. Oak bank teller cage partitions from SPS&K's former office in Morristown were also installed in their new space and are now the focal point of the reception area and library.

Name: Somerset Hills Learning Institute
Extended Description:
Project Type: Education

Project Size: 18,000 SF

Architect: Home & Associates

Located in the historic Pluckemin-Bedminster area of Somerset County, the 18,000 SF, Somerset Hills Learning Institute provides unique training for children with autism. The Walsh Company provided owner representation and project management services for entitlements, regulatory agency approvals, site development, and the design and construction of the facility.

Name: SunChemical
Extended Description:
Project Type: Corporate Interiors

Project Size: 70,000 SF

Architect: Gensler

This Corporate Headquarters facility for SunChemical North America, located in Parsippany, NJ represents Sun's commitment to technology, the production of quality products and employee focus. The Walsh Company was responsible for the oversight of the design, construction and relocation to this 70,000 SF space. The Walsh Company was instrumental in facilitating extensive renovations to the building's site and façade and managing the construction of a state of the art conferencing center, corporate fitness facility and cafeteria serving not only Sun Chemical but all of the building's occupants.

Name: The Medicines Company
Extended Description:
Project Type: Development

Project Size: 180,000 SF

Architect: HLW

As the Owner’s Representative for Hampshire Real Estate Companies,The Walsh Company managed the overall renovation of 8 Sylvan Way located in Parsippany, New Jersey. The project included a complete renovation of the existing 3-story, 80,000 SF office building and the construction of a new 3-story,100,000 SF addition. The buildings are joined by a glass atrium and feature new curtain walls consisting of glass and granite as well as all new building systems.The Walsh Company prepared all project budgets, oversaw all design, approvals and construction.

In addition, The Walsh Company provided Tenant Representation Services for The Medicines Company. The Walsh team oversaw all of the base building and tenant construction and hired and managed all of the professionals, consultants and vendors through there location. The interior build-out included a full service café, fitness center and state of the art training center.

Name: Watson Pharmaceuticals
Extended Description:
Project Type: Corporate Interiors

Project Size: 147,000 SF

Architect: TPG Architects

Watson Pharmaceuticals established their new corporate Headquarters in Parsippany, New Jersey. The Walsh Company served as the tenant representative. The project consisted of a complete interior renovation of Building A at 400 Interpace Parkway as well as the renovation of the third floor in the adjacent Building D located within the complex. The project size totaled 147,000 sf. The project features a new cafeteria complete with outdoor seating and an executive suite including a state-of-the-art board room. The workplace includes perimeter offices with glass office fronts and all new office and workstation furniture. Conference rooms throughout both buildings are equipped with video conferencing for communication with worldwide locations. Watson achieved LEED Certification for Commercial Interiors.

Name: Wyndham Worldwide
Extended Description:
Project Type: Tenant Improvement

Project Size: 250,000 SF

Architect: HLW

The Walsh Company provided Tenant Representation Services and Construction Management Services for Wyndham Worldwide on the build-out of their new headquarters facility located in Parsippany, New Jersey. Walsh managed the overall process including: project planning, budgeting and value engineering. This 250,000 sq.ft. three-story building is equipped with a Class A training center, fitness center, health services, credit union, coffee bar and café. The project was completed in February 2009.
